<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Twine - A lightweight data structure for efficiently representing the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// concatenation of temporary values as strings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A Twine is a kind of rope, it represents a concatenated string using a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// binary-tree, where the string is the preorder of the nodes. Since the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Twine can be efficiently rendered into a buffer when its result is used,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it avoids the cost of generating temporary values for intermediate string</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// results -- particularly in cases when the Twine result is never</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// required. By explicitly tracking the type of leaf nodes, we can also avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the creation of temporary strings for conversions operations (such as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// appending an integer to a string).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A Twine is not intended for use directly and should not be stored, its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// implementation relies on the ability to store pointers to temporary stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// objects which may be deallocated at the end of a statement. Twines should</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// only be used as const references in arguments, when an API wishes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to accept possibly-concatenated strings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Twines support a special &#39;null&#39; value, which always concatenates to form</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// itself, and renders as an empty string. This can be returned from APIs to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// effectively nullify any concatenations performed on the result.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\b Implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Given the nature of a Twine, it is not possible for the Twine&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// concatenation method to construct interior nodes; the result must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// represented inside the returned value. For this reason a Twine object</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// actually holds two values, the left- and right-hand sides of a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// concatenation. We also have nullary Twine objects, which are effectively</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sentinel values that represent empty strings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Thus, a Twine can effectively have zero, one, or two children. The \\see</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// isNullary(), \\see isUnary(), and \\see isBinary() predicates exist for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// testing the number of children.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We maintain a number of invariants on Twine objects (FIXME: Why):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  - Nullary twines are always represented with their Kind on the left-hand</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    side, and the Empty kind on the right-hand side.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  - Unary twines are always represented with the value on the left-hand</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    side, and the Empty kind on the right-hand side.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  - If a Twine has another Twine as a child, that child should always be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    binary (otherwise it could have been folded into the parent).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These invariants are check by \\see isValid().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\b Efficiency Considerations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The Twine is designed to yield efficient and small code for common</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// situations. For this reason, the concat() method is inlined so that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// concatenations of leaf nodes can be optimized into stores directly into a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// single stack allocated object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In practice, not all compilers can be trusted to optimize concat() fully,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// so we provide two additional methods (and accompanying operator+</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// overloads) to guarantee that particularly important cases (cstring plus</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// StringRef) codegen as desired.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Twine &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// NodeKind - Represent the type of an argument.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NodeKind : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// An empty string; the result of concatenating anything with it is also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// empty.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NullKind,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// The empty string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlight">      EmptyKind,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// A pointer to a Twine instance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlight">      TwineKind,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// A pointer to a C string instance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlight">      CStringKind,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// A pointer to an std::string instance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">      StdStringKind,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// A Pointer and Length representation. Used for std::string&#95;view,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// StringRef, and SmallString.  Can&#39;t use a StringRef here</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// LHS - The prefix in the concatenation, which may be uninitialized for</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Child <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// RHS - The suffix in the concatenation, which may be uninitialized for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Null or Empty kinds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Child <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// LHSKind - The NodeKind of the left hand side, \\see getLHSKind().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NodeKind LHSKind = EmptyKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// RHSKind - The NodeKind of the right hand side, \\see getRHSKind().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NodeKind RHSKind = EmptyKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Construct a nullary twine; the kind must be NullKind or EmptyKind.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">explicit</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a04fc8d246b44aea58511a60ccf88b907">Twine</a>(NodeKind Kind) : LHSKind(Kind) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> getRHSKind() == EmptyKind &amp;&amp; !isNullary();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> getLHSKind() != NullKind &amp;&amp; getRHSKind() != EmptyKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Check if this is a valid twine (satisfying the invariants on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// order and number of arguments).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> isValid()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Nullary twines always have Empty on the RHS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isNullary() &amp;&amp; getRHSKind() != EmptyKind)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Null should never appear on the RHS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (getRHSKind() == NullKind)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The RHS cannot be non-empty if the LHS is empty.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (getRHSKind() != EmptyKind &amp;&amp; getLHSKind() == EmptyKind)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A twine child should always be binary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (getLHSKind() == TwineKind &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">          !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>.twine-&gt;isBinary())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (getRHSKind() == TwineKind &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">          !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>.twine-&gt;isBinary())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Construct from a C string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// We take care here to optimize &quot;&quot; into the empty twine -- this will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// optimized out for string constants. This allows Twine arguments have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// default &quot;&quot; values, without introducing unnecessary string constants.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#afb94cb6089a1aa378b284c42b2f8a504"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;implicit&#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#afb94cb6089a1aa378b284c42b2f8a504">Twine</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Str) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Str&#91;0&#93; != </span><span class="doxyHighlightCharLiteral">&#39;\\0&#39;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>.cString = Str;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlight">        LHSKind = CStringKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">        LHSKind = EmptyKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(isValid() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Invalid twine!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Delete the implicit conversion from nullptr as Twine(const char &#42;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// cannot take nullptr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a7574a0d1443ab5ae315498557470e9e5"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;implicit&#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a7574a0d1443ab5ae315498557470e9e5">Twine</a>(std::nullptr&#95;t) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Unfortunately, to make sure this is as efficient as possible we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// need extra binary constructors from particular types. We can&#39;t rely on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the compiler to be smart enough to fold operator+()/concat() down to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// right thing. Yet.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Construct as the concatenation of a C string and a StringRef.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// SmallVector and a StringRef to the SmallVector&#39;s data is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#ac521760e9a45f304a4cbe46ed4fff845"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#ac521760e9a45f304a4cbe46ed4fff845">toStringRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;Out)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a2c57e3289e5e2f8023da85a982eeff09">isSingleStringRef</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#adaab019f83b94914fff161592767f663">getSingleStringRef</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#ae2cc7378ca67e19c45648f7800686933">toVector</a>(Out);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>(Out.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a7b68be12c974b6b70bc86062f221a344">data</a>(), Out.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This returns the twine as a single null terminated StringRef if it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// can be represented as such. Otherwise the twine is written into the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// given SmallVector and a StringRef to the SmallVector&#39;s data is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The returned StringRef&#39;s size does not include the null terminator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a5d968bc337af0be1f18813553a046df6">toNullTerminatedStringRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;Out) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Write the concatenated string represented by this twine to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// stream \\p OS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a5879f1eb58da7b477f75f9a980ebf145">print</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// @&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @name Twine Inline Implementations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a529bd775f25e1c6ea4a96b34a5d8bde6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Twine <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a529bd775f25e1c6ea4a96b34a5d8bde6">Twine::concat</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Twine &amp;Suffix)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Concatenation with null is null.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isNull() || Suffix.isNull())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a04fc8d246b44aea58511a60ccf88b907">Twine</a>(NullKind);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Concatenation with empty yields the other side.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isEmpty())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Suffix;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Suffix.isEmpty())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise we need to create a new node, taking care to fold in unary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// twines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Child NewLHS, NewRHS;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewLHS.twine = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewRHS.twine = &amp;Suffix;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NodeKind NewLHSKind = TwineKind, NewRHSKind = TwineKind;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isUnary()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewLHS = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewLHSKind = getLHSKind();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Suffix.isUnary()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewRHS = Suffix.LHS;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewRHSKind = Suffix.getLHSKind();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a04fc8d246b44aea58511a60ccf88b907">Twine</a>(NewLHS, NewLHSKind, NewRHS, NewRHSKind);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4443c9d3decc13b50e28950634dfeb9c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad7c8b5bd3872c6d5d4ba907eb030e78a">operator+</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>.concat(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>);</span></CodeLine>
